title: Calories in Cabernet Sauvignon
meta_description: Discover calories in cabernet sauvignon per glass, including carbs, alcohol content, and nutrition breakdown for this dry red wine.
assumptions: Dry Cabernet Sauvignon red wine, standard 5 oz (148 ml) serving at 13-14% ABV, no added sweeteners or mixers.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, vintage, alcohol content, and serving size. Check labels or apps for specific bottles.

quick_answer.text: A standard 5 oz glass of dry Cabernet Sauvignon contains about 125 calories, mostly from alcohol.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Off-dry style with higher residual sugar
Mixed as spritzer with soda water (no added sugar)

faqs.q: How many calories in a glass of cabernet?
faqs.a: About 125 calories in a standard 5 oz glass of dry Cabernet Sauvignon.
Yes, around 3.8 g carbs per glass, mostly from trace sugars and glycerol.

faqs.q: Calories in cabernet vs. other red wines?
faqs.a: Similar to most dry reds (120-130 kcal per glass); sweeter styles add 10-30 kcal.
Yes, only about 6 mg sodium per glass, making it heart-friendly in moderation.

faqs.q: How does serving size affect calories in cabernet?
faqs.a: Calories scale with volume; a 6 oz pour is ~150 kcal, while 4 oz is ~100 kcal.
